item.title: The Marvel of the Human Dad
item.description: The marvel of the Human Dad is a great article I stumbled upon the other day. It’s about the studies done by Anna Machin, a Oxford anthropologist, on the role and anthropologic reasoning that homo sapien fathers contribute to the family. This is a stark contrast between nearly all other mammal species (specifically all other 95%) where the non investing fathers commonly leave or dont provide for the newborn. Her reasoning tails on the fact that humans typically have a very short gestation period, which requires a lot of nurturing, and even an entire period of growth that no other mammal experiences (adolescents).
